Package database

Class DatabaseConnection

  • java.lang.Object
    • database.DatabaseConnection

  • public class DatabaseConnection
extends java.lang.Object
    An object representing a connection to a PostgreSQL database. All data will be stored in a table called "geo_data". This is to prevent SQL injection. Individual "tables" are actually just groups of features identified by the value in the "table_name_ attribute. If the "geo_data" table does not exist, it will be created upon initialization of this object.
    Since:
    22/11/17
    Author:
    isaac

                   throws java.sql.SQLException,
                          java.lang.ClassNotFoundException
        Constructor method for a PostgreSQL database connection object.
        Parameters:
        host - String representing the host address where the database is hosted.
        port - Integer representing the port number on which the database listens.
        database - String representing the name of the database to which to connect.
        user - String representing the user name with which to connect to the database.
        password - String representing the password with which to connect to the database.

                                                  throws java.sql.SQLException

        Returns:
